content: Hey, just learned from Yosh that there apparently isn't anything fundamental blocking variadic tuples and functions. I haven't contributed to the language in the past so I'm not at all familiar with the processes that would entail, and I don't want to make any commitment promises, but I'd definitely be interested in at least helping get things started

I think this is my first message on Zulip so quick intro; I'm Raphaël, Raph works, just not Raphael without the ümlauts. There is a small chance you have seen me other places on the internet. I have contributed a few things to Rust projects in the past but this would be my first major contribution
Have you seen the RFC issue already? https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/issues/376
Had not seen it, will give that a read thanks
while that has a long history, I hope it doesn't scare you away. A motivated new person might be just what it needs :)
There was a long discussion about variadic generics here, might be interesting as well if you haven't seen it
See also https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/pull/76#issue-782953326 from after we postponed variadics again in https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2775#issuecomment-712280380

A realistic expectations warning: as in that postpone, it's possible that we're still not at the point here it'd be practical to start work on them. For example, it might be that doing variadic inference should wait until the new solver is available.

Or perhaps it should be figured out at the type level (maybe in niko's new formalizations team, https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits/topic/making.20a.20team.20for.20traits.2C.20polonius.2C.20etc/near/273563728) before talking about syntax for it.
It's definitely feeling like the most useful to do right now would be to expand on the lang team notes you linked to try and add as much context as possible
There's a lot more to unpack than I expected from the initial conversation but it's all pretty interesting to read either way

It's definitely feeling like the most useful to do right now would be to expand on the lang team notes you linked to try and add as much context as possible

The previously quoted article I wrote on variadics already covers a lot of that context.
At the very least, it tries to explore the design space, not just a single proposal
Oh I hadn't gotten to reading that yet, that's greaat
